keyMoments.title: Sanji Volunteers to Fight Wanze Alone
keyMoments.description: Sanji tells Franky and Sogeking to go ahead and prioritize rescuing Robin while he stays behind to fight Wanze in train car 4.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Sanji's selflessness and trust in his crewmates, prioritizing the mission over his own safety.
keyMoments.quote: You two go on ahead. Rescuing Robin is the top priority.

keyMoments.title: Sanji Decides to Use His Hands
keyMoments.description: Angered by Wanze's disrespectful use of food as weapons, Sanji makes a rare exception to his 'never use hands in combat' rule, deciding to treat the battle as cooking rather than fighting.
keyMoments.significance: One of the very few times in the series where Sanji breaks his core fighting principle, showing both his anger at the misuse of food and his adaptability. This is a significant character moment.
keyMoments.quote: You're using food to fight... I'll make you eat all those noodles!

keyMoments.title: Hocho Sabaki and Epluchage Debut
keyMoments.description: Sanji unveils his kitchen knife techniques, borrowing Wanze's knives to perform Hocho Sabaki (Kitchen Knifework) and Epluchage, skillfully peeling away the ramen armor like preparing food.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases Sanji's culinary expertise as a legitimate combat skill, demonstrating that his true mastery is as a chef who can apply those skills in any situation.

abilities.description: A jumping kick aimed at the opponent's forehead. Named after the French culinary term for a thin boneless piece of meat.
Kitchen Knifework - a rare fighting style where Sanji uses kitchen knives instead of his legs. Only used when the opponent's 'armor' is made of food and they're in a kitchen setting.
A knife technique where Sanji peels away an opponent's armor like preparing food. Used to dismantle Wanze's ramen armor.

reveals.information: Sanji is willing to break his 'never use hands in combat' rule when facing an opponent who disrespects food
Sanji possesses expert knife skills that can be used in combat when the situation calls for it

keyMoments.title: Men's Formal Suit Ultimate Technique
keyMoments.description: Wanze swallows an entire sack of flour and creates his ultimate technique, forming a giant suit of armor made entirely of hardened ramen noodles.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the full extent of Wanze's Ramen Kenpo fighting style and forces Sanji to adapt his strategy.

keyMoments.title: Spiral Pattern Weakness
keyMoments.description: Wanze reveals that he becomes dizzy when seeing spiral patterns, including Sanji's distinctive eyebrows.
keyMoments.significance: Adds a comedic element while revealing a genuine weakness in Wanze's abilities.
keyMoments.quote: Your swirly eyebrows made me dizzy!

abilities.description: A unique fighting style that uses self-made ramen noodles as weapons, created by swallowing flour and processing it with saliva.
Fires hardened noodles from the nose like bullets, made from special Alloy Flour that becomes metal-hard.
A flaming kick attack using roller skates with circular blades that ignite from friction.
Ultimate technique forming giant noodle armor around the body for defense and enhanced striking power.
A powerful straight punch using the Men's Formal Suit armor, trapping opponents in sticky noodles.
A body slam attack where Wanze crashes the noodle armor down on trapped opponents.

reveals.information: Wanze becomes dizzy when he sees spiral patterns
Wanze's ultimate technique is the Men's Formal Suit, a full-body ramen armor

keyMoments.title: Franky vs Nero Begins
keyMoments.description: Franky engages CP9's newest member Nero on top of the speeding sea train, facing off against a Rokushiki user.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up Franky's battle against a CP9 agent, showcasing his combat capabilities.

keyMoments.title: Strong Hammer Attack
keyMoments.description: Franky attempts to use his Strong Hammer attack against Nero, though Nero dodges using Kami-e.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates one of Franky's signature attacks, though it proves insufficient against Rokushiki techniques.

abilities.description: A powerful hammer-like punch attack using Franky's cyborg-enhanced strength.

keyMoments.title: Octopus Shoes Plan
keyMoments.description: Sogeking gets the idea from Franky's insult to use his octopus shoes from Skypiea to walk along the side of the sea train.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Sogeking/Usopp's resourcefulness in repurposing old gadgets for new situations.

keyMoments.title: Sogeking Reaches Robin
keyMoments.description: Successfully uses octopus shoes to traverse the side of the speeding train and reach Robin's window, making first contact since her capture.
keyMoments.significance: A crucial step in the rescue operation, demonstrating determination and creative problem-solving.

reveals.information: Sogeking/Usopp still has the octopus shoes from the Skypiea arc

keyMoments.title: Battle Against Franky
keyMoments.description: Nero engages Franky in combat on top of the Puffing Tom, using his Rokushiki techniques to evade attacks.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases Nero's abilities as CP9's newest member and sets up his eventual defeat.

abilities.description: A Rokushiki technique allowing high-speed movement.
A Rokushiki technique allowing the user to kick the air and levitate.
A Rokushiki technique making the body flexible like paper to dodge attacks.
A Rokushiki technique that creates air slashes with powerful kicks.

reveals.information: Nero has mastered four of the six Rokushiki techniques: Soru, Geppo, Kami-e, and Rankyaku
Nero lacks Tekkai and Shigan, compensating with derringer flintlocks

keyMoments.title: Sogeking Reaches Her Window
keyMoments.description: Robin sees Sogeking tap on her window after he traverses the side of the train using octopus shoes.
keyMoments.significance: First direct contact with a crew member since being taken by CP9, setting up the emotional confrontation.
